item.title: Annie add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "But better to get hurt by the truth than comforted with a lie." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Annie add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Get busy living or get busy dying." -- Stephen King

item.title: Annie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Whenever a man does a thoroughly stupid thing, it is always from the noblest motives." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Annie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I can stand brute force, but brute reason is quite unbearable. There is something unfair about it's use. It is hitting below the intellect." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Annie add a quote by Mary Shelley
item.description: "...once I falsely hoped to meet the beings who, pardoning my outward form, would love me for the excellent qualities which I was capable of unfolding." -- Mary Shelley

item.title: Annie add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "Now this is the point. You fancy me a mad. Madmen know nothing. But you should have seen me. You should have seen how wisely I proceeded..." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Annie add a quote by Mary Shelley
item.description: "In my joy I thrust my hand into the live embers, but quickly drew it out with a cry of pain. How strange, I thought that the same cause should produce such opposite effects." -- Mary Shelley

item.title: Annie add a quote by Mary Shelley
item.description: "...learn from my miseries, and do not seek to increase your own." -- Mary Shelley

item.title: Annie add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Annie add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Annie add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "What do you think an artist is? ...he is a political being, constantly aware of the heart breaking, passionate, or delightful things that happen in the world, shaping himself completely in their image. Painting is not done to decorate apartments. It is an instrument of war." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Annie add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Annie add a quote by Will Rogers
item.description: "Why not go out on a limb? That's where the fruit is." -- Will Rogers

item.title: Annie add a quote by William Shakespear
item.description: "There is nothing either good or bad, but thinking makes it so." -- William Shakespear

item.title: Annie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Did my heart love till now? forswear it, sight! For I ne'er saw true beauty till this night." -- William Shakespeare
